fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25426].
  {panel}

There are cases that shows Confluence synchronization were hanging and Confluence still think that the process is running fine. Without intervening (restart and database modification) this process, synchronization will not stop.

This result to multiple issue such as

* Confluence lock the database table as the directory is on synchronization process
* No new data being retrieved from LDAP and will continue like this if Confluence administrator does not check the synchronization process
* Resource locked in memory
* It is necessary to change the configuration using database *UPDATE* query on *shutdown* mode

By implementing a configurable maximum time of synchronization for example 2 hours or less, we could avoid all the above issue as Confluence will give "Synchronization Failed" message instead of keep it running in the background
fields.summary: Maximum time of synchronization implementation

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25296].
  {panel}

When Editing a Page in Confluence 4.2 (with SSL), the Mixed Mode Security Warning is Prompted:
!secure.jpg!

This behavior will appear when the following conditions are met:
# The page contains at least 1 macro
# The Confluence Instance is SSL'ed
# Server running Confluence 4.2 (4.1 and below are not affected by this)
# Browser: IE8 (IE9 is not affected)

If the page contains *no macros*, then the prompt is not there.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Secure Confluence with SSL
# Navigate to Demonstration Space
# Edit the Home page of the Demonstration Space
# Alternatively, create a page with at least 1 macro (any macro, tested with Panel macro, Code macro, TOC macro, etc)
# Edit the page

h3.Workaround
# Disable the Mixed Mode prompt by going to (In IE) {{Tools >> Internet Options >> Security >> Custom Level}} (for the Internet/Intranet Zone), look for *Display mixed content*, and set it to *Disabled*.
fields.summary: IE8 Security Warning (Mixed Mode Prompt) When Editing a Page in SSL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25289].
  {panel}

When a user clicks on a full-sized image, a lightbox is displayed containing the same full sized image. This functionality makes sense for thumbnail images, however full sized-images should not have this enabled as it provides no useful benefit.

----

h5. The case for:
If users expect a larger image after clicking on the image, they might be less inclined to utilise this feature if they continually receive the same, full-sized image in the lightbox.

h5. The case against
This is pretty standard web functionality and it could confuse people if some images didn't show in a lightbox after a click. We might end up with a situation where people wonder if the functionality is working correctly and this might generate more support calls to internal IT and Atlassian.

h5. The workaround
Putting the image within a link to an anchor or ID on the page. This will disable the lightbox, albeit in a roundabout sort of way.
fields.summary: Disable lightbox for full-sized images

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25217].
  {panel}

Scope: 
- adding a Google Apps drawing to a confluence page
-- selecting the drawing by using a widget (would prefer a balsamiq-like integration though)

Problem: 
I can not add a Google Docs *drawing* to a confluence page as I could add a Google Docs *Document*. 
- When using a widget that uses the Google Documents Picker the drawing does not show up and can not be added. 
- When using the Widget connector the confluence page will only show a blank white area, not matter if I published to Web by making the drawing public or by requiring Google Apps credentials for viewing it.

Goal: 
- I want to have a scoping session with my development team pointing them to the design page on Confluence. If necessary anyone in the team should be able to click on the document, bringing it into edit mode and we could redraw live as necessary.

Workaround: 
- Create the Google Drawing
- Export it as PNG
- Attach the PNG to the Confluence page
- Copy the Google Docs link
- Add the Google Docs link to the Confluence page
- Do the review session
- Modify the Google Drawing
- Export it as PNG
- Attach the new PNG to the Confluence page

Suggested Solutions:

The ideal integration would just embed the Google Drawing into the Confluence page and anyone who wants to edit it could click on an "Edit"-link. 
Clicking on "Edit" would load the drawing into Google Docs.

The good-enough-solution would be to support drawings in the Widget Connector 
not requiring the publishing step in Google Docs, but just using the Google Docs link that has /edit at the end 

The goal must be to allow us to collaborate on the drawing, not requiring a manual update of links or attachments. The envisioned interaction is like the Balsamiq plug-in in a Google-Docs-Link-multi-user mode.
fields.summary: As a product owner using Google Apps I want to add a google drawing to a confluence page so that I can share diagrams with engineers

com.atlassian.confluence.plugins:confluence-like

The com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.like.DefaultLikeSummaryCreator composes sentences for the like summary, afaics these are seven possible sentences (see related issues).

The problem is that the composition approach works for English, and kind of works for German, but we're already in trouble for French. E.g. likes.summary.word.like, which is used for "Vous aimez ça" (You like this) and "2 personnes aimez ça" (2 people like this, but should really be "2 personnes aiment ça"). I'm sure there will be more problems arising when it comes to e.g. the Asian languages.

The correct implementation should be to have distinctive i18n keys for all possible sentences. Redundancy in i18n is a good thing ...

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25159].
  {panel}

Currently when using the search field in the top right corner of each Confluence page the user reaches a search page. This pages shows, on the right hand side, a grey box offering several search filters: "Where", "What", "When" and "Who".

These search filters are distracting for our users, because most of the options offered make no sense in our configuration. More precisely:

"Where" - The normal users access the wiki without login and the wiki is configured to consist of only *one* public space - so there is nothing to choose for these users. Things like "personal spaces" and "global spaces" only irritate average users, since they don't know (and need not know) what those mean.

"What" - Out users expect that a search searches on the wiki. Period.
- News-Entries - we don't have any news enabled.
- Comments - We don't use them either (our wiki is a documentation, not a discussion forum)
- Profile, Email - Users don't care about this either

"When" and "Where" - Those public users (not logged in) simply don't care who wrote the documentation when, neither should they care!


There are two improvements i'd like to suggest:
1. Make the "Where" and "What" filters more intelligent to only show options that make sense given the user group's permissions and the wiki's enabled/disabled features.

and/or (my preferred solution)
2. Make it configurable which search filters are available to which user groups. Our customers have asked us whether we can hide the grey filter box completely for public users, and I can understand perfectly well that these filters indeed don't help them. For admins, however, they can be useful.

Matthias Basler
fields.summary: Make search filteres more aware of user's permissions, hide unnecessary options

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25150].
  {panel}

Currently, if multiple user directories are defined in Confluence, the Add/Remove User operations will only be applied to the top directory. If the top directory cannot be modified via Confluence (e.g. LDAP read-only directory), the operation will fail.

In order to add a user to the Confluence Internal Directory in this configuration, one would need to swap the directory order in Confluence Admin > User Directories, add the user, then swap it back. This procedure is inconvenient and oftentimes confusing.

Instead, Confluence should automatically add the user to the Internal Directory if no other directory can be modified, and give a choice to the user if there are multiple possible directories (e.g. 'Confluence Internal Directory' and 'Internal with LDAP Authentication').

This behavior would also be more consistent with the user management behavior in JIRA.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25145].
  {panel}

In the Confluence 4.x editor, when the newline preceding a heading is deleted, the heading is reformatted to plain text. For example, when I have this text in the editor (as if it were entered using wikitext):

{noformat}
h1. First heading
Some text
h2. Second heading
More text
{noformat}

When I do this:

- Place cursor at the beginning of the word "Some"
- Hold shift and press down-arrow
- Press delete

I expect to end up with this:

{noformat}
h1. First heading
h2. Second heading
More text
{noformat}

But instead I end up with this:

{noformat}
h1. First heading
Second heading
More text
{noformat}

My heading formatting is lost. This is inconsistent with at least two other scenarios: (1) Deleting a newline preceding a bulleted list, and (2) Deleting a newline preceding a block of preformatted text, both of which retain the formatting of the text that follows the newline, which I think is correct/expected behavior.

Here is a [more detailed description of the issue|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=277252891#comment-277252891].
fields.summary: Heading loses formatting when preceding newline is deleted
